abstract: Carol Vogel Inside Art column; Sotheby's opens S2, selling and exhibition gallery, on second floor of its New York headquarters; Nasher Museum of Art at Duke University displays marble chair sculpted by Chinese artist and dissident Ai Weiwei; Amon Carter Museum of American Art acquires painting by Mary Cassatt; Laura Raicovich will leave Dia Art Foundation to become director of global initiatives at Creative Time.
snippet: Sotheby’s opens galleries in its Manhattan headquarters; the Nasher Museum buys an Ai Weiwei sculpture.
lead_paragraph: Sotheby’s opens galleries in its Manhattan headquarters; the Nasher Museum buys an Ai Weiwei sculpture.

headline.main: Sotheby’s as a Gallery; an Ai Weiwei at Duke
headline.seo: Sotheby’s as a Gallery; an Ai Weiwei at Duke
